entries.title: With a Pledge of Tanks for Ukraine, Biden Strengthens Allied Commitment
entries.description: The U.S. move follows Berlin’s decision to both send its Leopard tanks and allow other European countries to do the same.

entries.title: Two British Men Went to Soledar. Neither Came Back.
entries.description: Andrew Bagshaw, 47, and Chris Parry, 28, were part of an ad hoc cohort of foreigners who have gone to Ukraine despite little to no experience with combat situations.

entries.title: Your Thursday Briefing: Tanks for Ukraine
entries.description: Also, China’s natural gas shortage and India’s efforts to quash a Modi documentary.

entries.title: What to Know About Western Tanks Going to Ukraine
entries.description: Western allies have pledged to send at least 105 tanks, far less than Ukraine says it needs, and it may be months before they join the battle.

entries.title: Suspect Arrested After 2 Are Stabbed to Death on German Train
entries.description: The attack, which injured seven other people, happened on a regional train in northern Germany.

entries.title: Myrtle Witbooi, Who Fought for Domestic Workers’ Rights, Dies at 75
entries.description: She experienced the inequities of the job firsthand in South Africa and helped build national and international unions to address them.

entries.title: Ukraine’s Forces Have Retreated from Soledar After an Intense Battle
entries.description: Ukraine’s military acknowledged a gain for Russian forces that brings them closer to encircling the strategic eastern city of Bakhmut.

entries.title: Russia Says Tanks for Ukraine Are a ‘Losing Scheme’
entries.description: Dmitri Peskov, the Kremlin spokesman, said that delivering American M1 Abrams and German Leopard 2 tanks to Ukraine would burden Europe without strengthening the Ukrainian military.

entries.title: Pope Francis Says Homosexuality Is Not a Crime, but Is a Sin
entries.description: In an interview with The Associated Press, the pope said the church should do more to end laws that criminalize same-sex relations.

entries.title: France to Pull Troops Out of Burkina Faso, as Its Unpopularity in Africa Grows
entries.description: The West African country had demanded that French troops leave. France confirmed they would be out in a month.

entries.title: Getting tanks to the front lines looms as a challenge.
Spanish Police Make Arrest Linked to Letter Bomb Campaign
entries.description: A 74-year-old Spanish man was detained days after American and European officials said that Russian military intelligence officers might have directed the attacks.

entries.title: Spanish Police Arrest a Man in Letter Bomb Case
entries.description: A 74-year-old Spanish man made and sent all of the six letter bombs himself, the authorities alleged, though the “participation or influence of other people” was not ruled out.

entries.title: Tanzania’s Top Opposition Figure, Tundu Lissu, Returns From Exile
entries.description: Tundu Lissu, a former presidential candidate, left in 2020 after he was harassed on the campaign trail. He flew home after the country’s leader lifted a ban on political rallies.

entries.title: Inside a Nuclear War Bunker Built to Save Canada’s Leaders
entries.description: Amid renewed tensions with Russia, tourists are flocking to a decommissioned nuclear fallout shelter that Canada built to preserve its government during a nuclear war.

entries.title: Germany’s chancellor faced pressure at home and abroad over sending Ukraine tanks.
Biden Leery of Involvement in Potential Plea Deal in Sept. 11 Case
entries.description: A proposal to end a decade-long attempt to seek the death penalty before a military tribunal carries political risks, but the Trump administration also decided the system failed.

entries.title: In U.K. Cost-of-Living Crisis, Some Workers Struggle to Feed Children
entries.description: As inflation hits the pockets of families who already had little to spare, food banks say they are getting much busier and seeing more people with jobs.

entries.title: As India Tries to Block a Modi Documentary, Students Fight to See It
entries.description: Officials at a public university cut the electricity before a planned screening, and the government has prevented clips from appearing online.

entries.title: Climate Change May Bring New Era of Trade Wars, as E.U. and U.S. Spar
entries.description: Countries are pursuing new solutions to try to mitigate climate change. More trade fights are likely to come hand in hand.

entries.title: Your Wednesday Briefing
entries.description: More advanced weaponry for Ukraine.

entries.title: Natural Gas Shortages Hit China as Temperatures Plunge
entries.description: Local governments starved for cash after enormous spending on costly “zero Covid” measures cannot afford to keep up adequate supplies of gas.

entries.title: Imagery Shows How a Cemetery for Russian Mercenaries Is Expanding
entries.description: Recent satellite imagery and video footage offers a rare look at combat fatalities sustained by the Wagner mercenary group in Ukraine.

entries.title: U.S. Plans to Send Abrams Tanks to Ukraine, Officials Say
entries.description: The Biden administration had resisted sending tanks, which Ukraine says it needs, but the move is seen as likely to push Germany to approve the transfer of its own tanks.

entries.title: Ukraine Fires Officials Amid Corruption Scandal, as Allies Watch Closely
entries.description: As it fights Russia’s invasion, Ukraine depends for its survival on aid from Western nations, which have concerns about endemic graft and how the money is used.
